page.title: 10EBURNE SCHOOL WORK 1
page.content: There are three schools in the squares studied.One,Eburne is the oldest.This was built following the 1870 Education Act and was primarily the Wyken Colliery School.It was later re-named the Walsgrave Colliery School and is now called Eburne.The name suggests a possible link with the Eburne family who lived in Wyken and Allesley for four hundred years.Thomas Eburne was Mayor of Coventry in 1830.The old buildings are no longer used since the new Eburne site was developed in 1969. A former pupil visited us and told us how she was taught 50 years ago.Many of the children came from mining families.The classrooms were still evident.However since that time the Seventh Day Adventists have purchased the site and are making alterations.
